page.title: 07Exploring Old Houses
page.content: We went round Braybrooke looking for houses that might have been built before 1800.We only found 4.We went down the lane and found a very old house.The corners of the house were made of stone and the rest was made of brick,it would have belonged to someone quite wealthy in 1800.Next we went to a one-roomed sort of house built in 1777, it was near the pub.It only had 1 room which was downstairs.It was very small. We went to Laura's house,it was 3 cottages before but now made into 1.It had 3 chimneys,the window panes had criss-crosses.We looked at a newly thatched house,it was probably thatched in 1777 then tiled and thatched again. We did all this to find out what the houses would probably have been like in 1777.
